overview:
## Return Value

An initialized intent object or `nil` if the object could not be created.

## Discussion

Typically, you don’t create instances of this class yourself. Siri creates instances when the user asks to pause a workout. However, you can use this method during testing to create intent objects that validate your intent handling code paths.

# init(workoutName:)

**Initializer**

Initializes an intent object with the specified workout name.

## Declaration

```swift
init(workoutName: INSpeakableString?)
```

## Parameters

- **workoutName**: The name of the workout.

## Return Value

An initialized intent object or `nil` if the object could not be created.

## Discussion

Typically, you don’t create instances of this class yourself. Siri creates instances when the user asks to pause a workout. However, you can use this method during testing to create intent objects that validate your intent handling code paths.
